description: Construction of single storey detached outbuilding in rear garden for domestic use, ancillary to the main dwellinghouse
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: Block & Location Plan ref. HH-01-03-17 rev 0, received 13 November 2017; Block Plan-Proposed ref. PD-02-06-17 rev 0, received 13 November 2017; Floor Plan/Elevation-Proposed ref. PD-03-06-17 rev 1, received 13 November 2017; Floor Plan-Foundation / Excavation ref. PD-04-06-17 rev 0, received 13 November 2017; Floor Plan-M&E / Structure ref. PD-05-06-17 rev 0, received 13 November 2017; Floor Plan-Section/Detail ref. PD-06-06-17 rev 0, received 13 November 2017.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| The outbuilding hereby permitted shall be used for domestic purposes ancillary to the enjoyment of the main dwellinghouse at 61 Bennetts Avenue, Greenford, UB6 8AZ, only and not for any other use.

Reason: To prevent the creation of a separate self-contained residential unit of accommodation in the interests of  the living conditions of the existing and future residents of the site and to ensure that the use of the building does not, by reason of any other activity, harm the living conditions in the area, in accordance with policies 1.1,1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), SPG 4, and policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 3.5, 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment or new Order), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), SPG 4, policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| No kitchen shall be installed into the outbuilding at any time.

Reason: To prevent the creation of a separate self-contained residential unit of accommodation in the interests of  the living conditions of the existing and future residents of the site and to ensure that the use of the building does not, by reason of any other activity, harm the living conditions in the area, in accordance with policies 1.1,1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), SPG 4, and policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 3.5, 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Prior to commencement of the development, a noise assessment report shall be submitted for approval in writing by the Council, of sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing and other mitigation measures such as acoustic lobby etc. as appropriate.  Details shall demonstrate that noise from the use and activities is contained within the building and does not exceed the criteria of BS8233:2014 at neighbouring noise sensitive/ habitable rooms and private external amenity spaces. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013) and SPG10: Noise and Vibration.

| The use shall not commence until all external doors to the premises have been fitted with self-closing devices, which shall be maintained in an operational condition and at no time during the use of the music studio shall any external door nor windows be fixed in an open position.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013) and SPG10: Noise and Vibration.

| Ensure the external sound level LAeq emitted from plant/ machinery/ equipment is lower than the lowest existing background sound level LA90 by at least 5dBA measured at the nearest and/or most affected noise sensitive premises, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity, at all times.  Any necessary noise mitigation measures shall be permanently retained.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013) and SPG10: Noise and Vibration.

| Prior to use, machinery, plant or equipment at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013) and SPG10: Noise and Vibration.

| External artificial lighting at the development shall not exceed lux levels of vertical illumination at neighbouring premises that are recommended by the Institution of Lighting Professionals in the 'Guidance Notes For The Reduction Of Light Pollution 2011'.  Lighting should be minimized and glare and sky glow should be prevented by correctly using, locating, aiming and shielding luminaires, in accordance with the Guidance Notes.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013) and SPG10: Noise and Vibration.
